results.summary: A 22-year-old man arrested on suspicion of fatally stabbing 16-year-old Christina Edkins in Birmingham is sectioned under the Mental Health Act.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/eb82a58a-6b9a-4c4e-ba00-6a08c03d2f96"><image id="66252167"/><paragraph role="introduction">A 22-year-old man arrested on suspicion of fatally stabbing schoolgirl Christina Edkins on a bus in Birmingham has been sectioned under the Mental Health Act.</paragraph><paragraph>The 16-year-old was stabbed on a bus on Hagley Road on Thursday, while on her way to school in Halesowen.</paragraph><paragraph>A post mortem examination revealed she died from a single stab wound to the chest.</paragraph><paragraph>West Midlands Police said the suspect would now be sent to a secure facility. </paragraph><paragraph>Officers said an assessment by mental health professionals deemed him unfit to be interviewed any further by detectives. </paragraph><paragraph>They said the 22-year-old, a British national with links to Walsall, was not previously known to mental health units in the area and has no known link to the teenager.</paragraph><paragraph>Christina is understood to have boarded the number 9 bus minutes before the attack, which happened at about 07:40 GMT.</paragraph><crosshead>'Senseless and random'</crosshead><paragraph>Police said it was part of Christina's regular daily routine to get the bus at that time.</paragraph><!-- Embedded video --><video media-id="66282375">    <caption>Pupils at Leasowes High School have mourned the death of Christina Edkins</caption>  </video><paragraph>A woman claiming to have witnessed the incident on the bus said she waited for the girl's attacker to get off the vehicle before performing CPR.</paragraph><paragraph>Writing on Facebook, she said she was "deeply traumatised" she could not save the teenager.</paragraph><paragraph>Det Supt Richard Baker said Christina's family were distraught over the seemingly "senseless and random" attack.</paragraph><paragraph>Fellow pupils, parents and staff at Leasowes High School in Halesowen have laid more than 100 bunches of flowers outside the school gates in her memory.</paragraph><paragraph>Other friends gathered near the scene on Hagley Road to pay their respects.</paragraph></body>
